title: Add Google Search Console HTML file verification

requirements.text: Add Google Search Console ownership verification by serving the provided HTML verification file at the site root: create a static file named `google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html` whose contents are exactly `google-site-verification: google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html`, and ensure it is accessible at `https://<site-domain>/google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html`.
acceptanceCriteria: A file named `google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html` exists in the frontend static public output (served from the site root).
The response body of `/google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html` is exactly: `google-site-verification: google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html` (including punctuation).
No React route intercepts or overrides the verification file path (it must be served as a static file, not an SPA route).

constraints: Do not modify any files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep the backend architecture unchanged (single Motoko actor); no backend changes are required for this verification file.
nonGoals: Implementing broader SEO features (sitemaps, robots.txt tuning, structured data, or analytics).
Adding Google verification via DNS or Search Console meta tag (only the provided HTML file verification is required).
